Posts.Content: Hi everyone, I’m having a few issues in finding the right prosthesis and wondered if anyone had had a similar issue. It seems that the fuller breasted women that are catered for are also wide in the chest, (which I’m not!) The prosthesis I am currently wearing is, quite frankly, a joke and I am hugely disappointed that this is apparently the best the NHS can offer me. It’s taken 4 months of toing and fro ing to the orthotics dept to be left hugely disappointed and incredibly frustrated with a prosthesis I remove as soon as I walk through the front door. Has anyone had a similar issue, or would you be able to point me to some further assistance please? Many thanks in anticipation.
Posts.Title: Breast prothesis sizing issue

Posts.Content: Thanks Granny59. You made me smile! Have to be honest, not the response I was expecting but will have a look at anything. My Mum would have found it incredibly amusing if I end up with a knitted prothesis as she could knit anything! Who knows, I might even get round to knitting one myself
Posts.Title: Breast prothesis sizing issue

Posts.Content: Dear all, my beautifully crafted knitted knocker arrived today. Will keep you posted as to how I get on but immediate impression is that it is much more comfortable than silicone one. Thank you for all your advice and support x
Posts.Title: Breast prothesis sizing issue
